meanings.definition: To deliberately underestimate or downplay one's abilities or intentions.
meanings.sent1: She sandbagged her skills during the interview to appear more humble.
meanings.sent2: He always sandbagged his true potential to surprise everyone later.
meanings.sent3: The magician sandbagged his magic tricks, making the audience doubt his abilities.
meanings.sent4: The student sandbagged his intelligence, pretending to struggle with the test.
meanings.sent5: The athlete sandbagged his speed, only to sprint ahead at the last moment.

meanings.definition: To obstruct or impede progress or development.
meanings.sent1: The fallen tree sandbagged the path, blocking our way forward.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain sandbagged the construction site, delaying the project.
meanings.sent3: The traffic jam sandbagged our journey, making us late for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The technical issue sandbagged the software release, causing a delay.
meanings.sent5: The closed road sandbagged our travel plans, forcing us to take a detour.

meanings.definition: To fortify or protect with sandbags.
meanings.sent1: They sandbagged the riverbank to prevent flooding during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers sandbagged their position to defend against enemy attacks.
meanings.sent3: The homeowners sandbagged their doors to protect against the approaching hurricane.
meanings.sent4: The volunteers sandbagged the levee to reinforce it before the heavy rains.
meanings.sent5: The workers sandbagged the construction site to secure it from erosion.
